utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Do I smell coffee?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: If you do, it was made by elves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Geez.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: You scared me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I think we all just kick-started our day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, my tutoring job went late and the train wasn’t running back to my place, so I crashed here. I hope you don’t mind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! No, of course not. Matter of fact, um … now that you’ve broke up with your boyfriend there’s really no reason you can’t move back in here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Actually there are many reasons. Starting with, I have a lease?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, I told you I would help you with that. And you know I don’t like you living in that place alone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, it’s fine. I can handle it. I’ve gotta go. I’ve got an early class.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And we have an early murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was one thing when she was living there with Pi, but now that she’s alone why not dump the dump and come home?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe she’s enjoying her independence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She doesn’t have time for independence. She’s got her tutoring gigs, her classes, her work study job. She’s exhausted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well Castle, I mean, she’s strong willed. Maybe it’s pride.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If it were pride she’d be more … well, proud. No, it’s something else. Another reason why she’s not coming home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘sito!

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone miss their checkout?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He checked out, all right. Housekeeping found this guy, Justin Marquette, dead in 147. His driver’s license says he lives nearby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Single gunshot to the chest?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: One is all it took. Based on the entry wound, I’d say a small caliber handgun. Lividity and liver temp put the time of death between 10PM and midnight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he wasn’t found until morning?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how come no one heard the shot?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All the neighboring rooms are empty. The manager says that the place is only about 40% occupied.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did the manager mention him checking in with anyone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The room was in his name alone. Ryan is trying to track down the desk clerk from last night to see if he can get some more details. There’s no sign of forced entry, though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So either the killer was with him, or the victim let him in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like he took a bottle of water from this mini fridge, turned back around, got shot, and then he took the chair down with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s no luggage. You said he lived nearby. What was he doing here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. I checked his phone; there was no indication of a meeting. There was no appointments, texts, or calls in the hours leading up to his death.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. I found the desk clerk who checked in Justin Marquette. Something was up with this guy.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Mr. Marquette came in about 8. No reservation, which is not unusual.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jane, tell them about the room.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: That was unusual. He asked to stay in room 147. In fact, he insisted on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is there anything special about 147?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: No, all our rooms are identical, which is why it was so strange.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Had he been here before?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Well, he’s not in the system, which means he’s never been a guest at any Best Traveler hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he mention why he was staying?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: He didn’t have to. Good looking guy, no bags, checking in for one night? In my experience that means he was here to hook up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he come here with anyone?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: No, but he was texting with someone. I figured that’s who he was meeting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He texted? Are you sure? We didn’t find any texts on his phone.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I’m positive.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: There. See? He’s texting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On a flip phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not the phone we found.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: As far as I can tell, that’s the only cellphone registered to Justin Marquette.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the one we saw in the video must be a second secret one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which the killer took to hide their identity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who is this guy, why a second phone, and why room 147?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I didn’t get much from hotel security video. Coverage is sketchy and there are no cameras in the hallway outside Justin’s room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get ahold of the next of kin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not yet, but I did find out about of victim thought his personal website.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s got his own website?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s an actor – and a struggling on, judging by his credits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Justin Marquette is a member of the Rooster Theater Company and is currently appearing in their off-off-off Broadway production of Chekhov’s Platonov. That’s … a lot of –offs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s see if anyone down there knows what he was into.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: This is the absolute end. What’s going on out there?

utterance.speaker: LAURA WESTBOURNE
utterance.content: Joseph’s been lynched by the villagers.

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: I’m sorry, this is a closed rehearsal.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: NYPD. I’m Detective Beckett. We’re hear about Justin Marquette.

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: What about Justin? Is he okay?

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: We met through the theater company and started dating three months ago. I knew something was wrong when he didn’t show up for rehearsal today.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw him?

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: Yesterday morning at my place. We um … we went for a run and then he showered and left for work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where did he work?

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: Temp jobs, mostly. He wasn’t getting much recently, but he said he didn’t mind because because it gave him more time to spend with me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea what he would be doing at the Best Traveler hotel last night?

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: No – hotel? He was at a hotel?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Laura, I know this is difficult, but is it possible that Justin was seeing someone else?

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: What? No!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was he involved in anything dangerous or illegal?

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: No, not that I know of. No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was there anyone in his life that may have wanted to hurt him?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: There was that thing the other day, remember?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What thing?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Some crazy woman walked up to him on the street and threatened him.

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: That’s right. Justin was totally rattled. He could barely perform that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he know who she was?

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: Uh uh. And he did not want to talk about it, either. All he said was that it happened outside a coffee shop on 9th and Mercer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks. Hey. That was the coffee shop. A barista saw the whole thing go down. A woman walked up to Justin outside and started yelling at him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You get a description?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I did better than that. She’s a regular customer and she’s got a loyalty card. Her name’s Anita Miller. I’ll send a unit to pick her up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks for coming in, Ms. Miller. I’m Detective Beckett. Uh … I just need to ask you a few questions about –

utterance.speaker: ANITA MILLER
utterance.content: Justin Marquette.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you know him?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I more than know him, Detective. In fact, I killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you confessing?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I’m just … give me some paper. I want to write it all down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eleven seconds to a confession. That’s got to be your personal best.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You sound like you’re disappointed, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I am. A little. I mean, a secret phone, room 147? This case had a conspiratorial premise.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, most likely Justin was cheating on his girlfriend with Anita and the two of them met up at the hotel and that’s where things went south.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, well, most likely that is boring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, not every case has to be shrouded in mystery and intrigue.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Uh … we got a problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I was looking into Anita Miller’s whereabouts try to tie her to the hotel, except her credit card records show that she was at Mavaggio restaurant last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So maybe someone else used her credit card.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah, the manager ID’d her. And he said she split the bill with another guy. Her AA sponsor. I just spoke to him and he confirmed that they were together from 9:30PM to 12:30AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But that’s our entire time of death window. If that’s true then Anita can’t be our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why is she confessing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not so boring after all.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: So Anita Miller is confessing to the murder and she has an alibi?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. We’re still trying to make sense of it, Sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well is it possible that we misjudged the time of death?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No, Lanie stands behind her examination.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, then what about the alibi?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito verified it with the restaurant. The manager, the hostess, even the waiter confirmed that Anita was there all evening. Not only that, but this restaurant is nowhere near the hotel.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then she couldn’t have killed him. So find out why she’s lying.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: It’s all there. Everything I remember about what I did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we just wanted to go over this in person. Just to clear up any discrepancies.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: What discrepancies?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, why don’t you just tell us what happened?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I went to see him in his room -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which room was that?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: Room 147.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Room 147?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: At the Best Traveler hotel.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I knocked on the door. He opened it almost immediately.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: Been waiting for you. Come on in. Let me get you a water.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: He offered me a water and then he went to the mini fridge. That’s when I took out the gun.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: He turned around to give me the water.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I shot him. I shot him in the chest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then what happened?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: He looked surprised. He staggered back. He dropped the water and he kind of gripped onto the back of this chair. Then he fell and knocked it over.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s exactly how we found the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She must have been there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How? How is that possible?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anita, what was your relationship with Justin Marquette?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: My relationship?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were the two of you involved?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then how did you know him.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I’m not sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you don’t know how you know him, then why would you kill him?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I’m an alcoholic. He was responsible for my drinking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How was he responsible?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I don’t know. I’m – I’m sorry. I’ve been really confused lately.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because of the drinking?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: No. I’ve been sober for four years. God knows I still struggle, but these last two weeks, they’ve just been really … blurry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember going to dinner with your sponsor last night?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: Was that last night?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: Yes, you’re right. It was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then when did you go to the hotel and meet Justin?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I don’t remember.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anita, we have a witness that saw you accost Justin outside a coffee shop a couple of days ago. Do you remember that?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: Yes, I do. Uh, he was talking to this big bald man. I had to warn Justin. To tell him that he was in danger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From the bald man.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: No. From me. The moment I saw Justin I just had this awful feeling that I was going to hurt him. And I did.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Thanks. So no one at the hotel saw Anita last night and tech can’t find her in any of the can footage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This doesn’t make any sense. She knows details about our crime that only our killer could know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about forensics? Did CSU come up with anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, a hotel room in New York City? They found all kinds of fun stuff. But nothing to tie Anita back to room 147.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well maybe it’s an act. You know? Some kind of smoke screen and she’s taking the fall for someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except she had to have known that we would check her alibi, which completely contradicts her confession.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hum. All right. C’mon, huh? Give us one of your theories, bro.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on. Whatever it is, it can’t be any crazier that what we’re already dealing with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Mmm… I think …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: … I’m man enough to admit I’m completely theory-less.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe Anita suffered some kind of psychotic break.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve ordered a psych eval, but psychosis doesn’t explain how she knew all about the murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or why she killed the guy in the first place. I double checked her phone records. Not a single call or text between her and Justin Marquette. It’s like they had no history at all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, why don’t you guys go over to her apartment and check everything. Emails, calendars, her diary and let’s see if we can find anything there that’ll connect her to our victim.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. We’re on it.

utterance.speaker: DOC HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, Mr. Castle. Nice to see you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you so much for coming in, Doctor Holloway.

utterance.speaker: HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: I gather you have a patient for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well we’ve been through every room of the house. No gun, no bloody clothes, nothing that links Anita back to that crime scene or to Justin.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe not, but check out her datebook. Some pages have been ripped out, including all of the last two weeks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two weeks? Wait a minute, that’s how long Anita says she’s been feeling blurry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe she kept a calendar on her computer. Yeah. And it looks like the same two weeks have been erased.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It looks like someone is trying to cover something up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but who? And what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As much as I love a good mystery, a small part is hoping he can give us some clarity on what the hell is going on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Speaking of clarity, what did you mean when you said that there might be something else that’s keeping Alexis from moving back to your loft?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. And Alexis won’t talk about it, so … maybe when Doctor Holloway is done talking to Anita I can get him to talk to Alexis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So, what’s the verdict?

utterance.speaker: HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: Based on my examination so far, I find her to be mentally competent, if somewhat disoriented. By all indication she seems to be telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meaning … she did kill Justin Marquette?

utterance.speaker: HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: Or she believes she did, anyway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what about the disorientation? How do you account for that?

utterance.speaker: HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: Could be medical, or neurologic condition, or an adverse reaction to drugs. It’s possible she experienced a traumatic event which caused some sort of retrograde amnesia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So traumatic like killing someone?

utterance.speaker: HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: Potentially. I’m going to do a full workup. I’ll know more when the results come back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Doctor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Anita Miller believes she killed the victim, but the facts say she couldn’t have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not all the facts. I mean, we know she accosted Justin outside the coffee shop. She confessed to the murder and she had intimate knowledge of the crime. So, look, clearly we haven’t explained everything, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you believe she killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think that until something changes, she’s our best suspect.

utterance.speaker: SAM CARSON
utterance.content: I want to confess to a murder. I killed Justin Marquette.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d say something just changed.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Yeah, it was me. Don’t get me wrong, it’s not like I’m proud of it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Did I hear right? Another person has confessed to this murder?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but I think he’s some kind of attention seeker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, so far the confession’s just a rehash of the news report.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Carson, do you realize that making false statements to the police is a crime?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I’m telling you the truth. I killed the guy. In his hotel room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. What room was that?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Um …

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Room 147.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: It was room 147.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need you to tell me exactly what happened.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I was in his room –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. I need details. Were you hiding in the closet? Did you kick down the door?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: No. I knocked.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: Been waiting for you. Come on in. Let me get you a water.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: He let me in, offered me a water.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A water?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Yeah, like a bottle. He – he went to the fridge. That’s when I pulled out my gun.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: He turned around and I shot him. Right in the chest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then what?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: He fell back, grabbed a chair, knocked it over when he fell down. Then I left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did you kill him?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Because I was angry. I’ve got anger issues, you know? When I saw him I was just … filled with rage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because he did what to you?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: That’s – that’s the part I’m not too clear on. The last - last couple of weeks have been kind of hazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you know the victim?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I don’t – I don’t know that I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, he filled you with rage and you don’t know him? Why did you go to room 147 in the first place? Did he contact you?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I don’t remember.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you not remember? What kind of game are you playing here?

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I’m not playing any game!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what I think you’re doing? You’re trying to sabotage my case. You know that no DA is going to get a conviction with multiple confessions!

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Multiple confessions?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you and Anita Miller are working together on this. You’re either covering for each other or you’re covering for someone else out there.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Who the hell is Anita Miller?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know who she is.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I’ve never seen that woman before in my life.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I’m telling you, I don’t know him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure about that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because Sam told us the same story that you did, but that he killed Justin.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: Well he’s lying. I killed Justin Marquette.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we can’t find a link between Sam and Anita or between either one of them and our victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Sam’s alibi?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His brother says that he and Sam were at the batting cages all last night and based on the security video, Sam never set foot in the hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They both believe they killed Justin, they both know details about the murder, and they both have similar memory problems. I mean, they must be connected. What if their lives intersect, just not in such a literal sense?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle. No. Please. If this is some alternate universe theory, I’m not in the mood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Alternate universe? That’s how little you think of me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’m – I’m sorry. I just thought that you –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, they’re psychically linked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And not just to each other, but to the actual killer. See, they’re seeing the crime through his or her eyes. And the experience is so visceral that both Sam and Anita think that they committed the crime themselves.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, it’s just, you got excited. It’s kind of cute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. You know how I like the weird stuff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … it’s nobody. Nothing. It’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Another what?

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT CARRUTHERS
utterance.content: I’m Dwight Carruthers, CPA. I’m here to turn myself in. For killing Justin Marquette.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. This is now officially outstanding.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. You guys need to see this.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: Wait, I – I need to confess.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Take a number.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Once we realized that someone might have gone through Anita’s apartment, we had unis canvass the area. Now, one of Anita’s neighbors remembers seeing a red van parked outside her place about two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right when she started feeling disoriented.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, not only that, we checked in with Sam Carson’s neighbors. Turns out one of them remembers seeing the same red van parked outside of Carson’s house a few nights later. She remembers it because she thought it looked suspicious.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get a plate number?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but she took a picture with her phone. Take a look at who’s behind the wheel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A big, bald man, just like the one Anita said she saw talking to our victim outside the coffee shop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So our victim and two suspects do have something in common.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So now there are three of them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, Sir. But we believe that this man is the key to our case. His van was seen outside both Anita and Sam’s apartments and Anita ID’d him as the guy that was talking to our victim outside the coffee shop.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And what is this man’s connection to Mr. Carruthers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what I’m going to find out.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: I’m prepared to take full responsibility and admit to what I did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, I’m sure you are. Now, do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: Don’t you want to hear my confession?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Best Traveler hotel, room 147, Justin offered you water, and then you shot him.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: How – how did you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett? Just like the one Anita drew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dwight, what does that symbol mean?

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: Uh … I – I don’t know. It’s just been stuck in my head lately. But what difference does that make? I shot a guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know. Now, can you take a closer look at these pictures and tell me if you recognize that man?

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: Uh … no. But the van looks familiar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve seen it before? Where?

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: I’m – I’m not sure. I’ve been –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Confused recently? Like the last two weeks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dwight, think. This is important.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: It was last Tuesday. Around noon. I was coming home from assertiveness training and it was parked on Houston Street up outside my apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There are traffic cams on Houston. Might have caught a plate number.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: Seriously? I killed someone and all you care about is a van.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, tech scrubbed traffic cam footage from last Tuesday on Houston and they got a hit on our vehicle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Traced it to a Miles Madsen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. That’s our guy. So what do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s in the wind. Uniforms hit his apartment, but the landlord says he hasn’t seen Madsen in weeks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, put out an APB. Find out everything you can about him. Right now he’s the only link connecting all these people.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … I’ve got an errand to run. Can you tell Castle I’ll be back in an hour?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks for meeting with me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. What’s so important?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … you know that I don’t take sides on anything between you and your dad, right?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. I appreciate that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well … your dad wants you to move back home. And I know that you said you have a lease, but you also said that there were other reasons why you didn’t want to move back and I – I just … I want to make sure one of those reasons isn’t me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh no. No, no, it’s – it’s not you at all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure? Because the last thing I want to do is make you feel unwelcome in your own home.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. It’s … not you, it’s me. All those things my dad said when I was moving out. About me making a mistake, moving in with my boyfriend. He was right. I can see it so clearly now. Why didn’t I then?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were in the love haze.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The love haze?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s like a drug. It makes intelligent people do stupid things. And then it clears and you look around and wonder ‘what was I thinking?’. You dad just wants to help. It’s okay to let him.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes. But this was my mistake. He shouldn’t have to pay for it. So I will tutor and do whatever I have to until the lease is up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I get it. But … look. I know what you’re doing seems noble, but it’s not. I mean, the long hours, the exhaustion? What you’re actually doing is punishing yourself. Trust me. I’ve been there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This – this isn’t necessary. Your dad loves you, he worries about you. I think your penance is paid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I have to go. Just think about it, okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll see you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Did you guys find Madsen?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but we’re getting close. We got that he’s an independent contractor for Apollo Pinnacle Inc.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which turns out to be a front for another organization called EHI, or Eternal Horizons Institute.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what is that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, to quote their website, “EHI provides sanctuary, enlightenment, and pathways to the ultimate self”. They claim to have thousands of followers all over the world.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But not all of them are satisfied customers. In 2005 three of those followers died in some kind of sweat lodge initiation. Charges were filed but ultimately the deaths were ruled accidental.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Followers? Initiations? This thing sounds like a cult.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it’s a cult, all right. Complete with a charismatic and sinister leader brought to you courtesy of this recruitment video.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Gustavo Bauer? So what is he a doctor of?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It says here he holds a PhD in transpersonal psychology.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: From Never Heard Of It University?

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: - biocognative program to help free you from the negative anchors holding you down so you can soar. Visit us at one of the Eternal Horizon Institute’s many reception centers and take the first step at becoming the person you were truly meant to be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait for it …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the symbol that Anita and Dwight were drawing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and the boys checked. Sam’s been drawing it as well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so the three of them must have been a part of whatever the hell this thing is. That’s our connection.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Except we asked each of them. They all deny being members.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but they also said that they killed Justin Marquette and we know that that’s not true, either. So where is this EHI?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right here in the city. Midtown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This case is exceeding even my expectations. An impossible murder connected to a shadowy and mysterious cult.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not to mention prosperous. This is prime real Manhattan real estate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi. We’re here to see Dr. Bauer –

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. Richard Castle. Welcome to EHI. Dr. Bauer’s expecting you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How? We didn’t make an appointment.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Dr. Bauer’s a brilliant man. Right this way.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: He’s just inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … no he’s not.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: On the contrary.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. That is so … Big Brother.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: Greetings Detective Beckett, Mr. Castle. What can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you could start by speaking with us in person.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: Regrettably I’m in Stockholm conducting a seminar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Well then, do you know this man? Justin Marquette.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: I’m afraid not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about this man? Miles Madsen. I understand he works for you.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: Mr. Madsen has not been employed by EHI for some time. Years, in fact.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well what did Mr. Madsen do when he worked for you?

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: Since he is no longer in my employ I don’t see the relevance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The relevance is that he is connected to a murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: I’m struck by the level of your hostility, Detective. It’s not healthy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what I’m struck by is your total lack of curiosity as to why a homicide detective is asking about your employee.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: Former employee.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well whatever he is he is definitely involved in this case. Along with three other members of your little group: Anita Miller, Sam Carson, Dwight Carruthers.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Detective. Those people are not part of EHI.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. That’s – amazing, how you would just know what off the top of your head.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: I make a point of meeting every member of my EHI family. The people you mentioned are not among them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then I’m sure you won’t mind if we check your files. Along with the records you have on Miles Madsen.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: You’ll need a warrant for that, Detective. And you won’t get one.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: What’s that? They’re ready? I’m sorry, my session is ready. Jasmine will show you out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Dr. Bauer, I –

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Right this way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bauer was right. Judge turned us down for a search warrant.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You really think EHI’s grand poobah is behind this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think that he knows where Madsen is and that Madsen is still working for him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But doing what? And what does any of this have to do with a struggling actor like Justin Marquette?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh, what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, the EHI website. The testimonials claim that they have programs to quit smoking, quit drinking, take charge of their lives …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So all three of our confessors have had problems in their lives. Alcoholism, anger management, assertiveness issues, all things that they could have gone to EHI to treat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But they all claim that they didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if they did? What if they did but something made EHI want to eliminate any record of their involvement? Torn datebook pages, wiped calendars. Maybe that’s why Madsen went to their apartments, to erase any trace of their connection to EHI.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you can’t just do that by wiping out calendars. You’d have to –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wipe memories. Think about it. The fogginess, the confusion over the last two weeks?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you’re saying that a glorified self-help group can erase memories? How?

utterance.speaker: HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: With drugs. Anita Miller’s tests came back. I found unusual levels of a propranolol derivative in her system. So I tested Mr. Carson and Mr. Carruthers. It was in their blood as well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Propranolol?

utterance.speaker: HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: In small doses it’s generally a blood pressure drug. In high doses it’s been found to alter memories, even eliminate them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If it can alter memories, could it make someone believe they had done something they actually hadn’t?

utterance.speaker: HOLLOWAY
utterance.content: Under normal circumstances the human brain is very suggestible. Combined with a drug like this, I’d say it’s entirely possible. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Outstanding. This is straight out of Inception. Someone planted the memory of the murder in all three of their heads while erasing all knowledge of their connection to EHI.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, do you have any idea how insane that sounds?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a diabolical plan. Have three suspects confess to the same crime, making it impossible for the police to arrest anyone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But none of this explains how they all knew the details of the murder without actually being there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe they were there, just not in person. What if Justin’s killer filmed the murder and then showed it to these people while they were in their drug induced state? They would think the images were drawn from their own experience.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If they were shown the actual murder then that makes all three of them witnesses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With details of the crime that could lead to our real killer.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: I’m telling you, I pulled the trigger myself.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: So did I.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I understand that it seems real to you, but it may not be.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: But why would somebody do this to us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To get away with murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We just need you to tell us everything you … remember about being in that hotel room down to the last overheard whisper or a glimpse of a shadow in a mirror.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now keep in mind that what seems like a minor detail to you may actually be the key to use solving this case, so let’s start with Anita.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: The first thing I remember is knocking on the door of 147. After a few seconds Justin opened it. He smiled flirtatiously –

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Okay, he did not flirt with me.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: No, he was businesslike.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what did you see when you went into the room?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I remember the carpet. It was beige. The wallpaper had a subtle floral pattern and there was a painting above the fridge. I – I think it was a landscape.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: Yeah, of a countryside.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: And when he pulled out the bottle of water from the fridge, I remember there were six other bottles in the fridge door there.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: No, no. There were five. I remember that clear as day.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: No, there were six.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: I remember five, too.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: See?

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: I know what I saw.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: You saw wrong. There were five. He saw five, I saw five. You saw …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, if they can’t agree on the details then I don’t think we’re going to learn anything here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Au contraire. We’ve already learned something very, very important. Come with me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’re we going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Back to the hotel.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: You are clearly lying, okay? I -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle, could you just tell me what this is all about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not until I know I’m right. Which … I am. You should know you’re engaged to a genius.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, a genius at annoying me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I’m Justin and you are one of the several people who shot me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m starting to feel the urge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I go to get you a bottle of water and tell me – – how many bottles do you see in the fridge?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: None. The door’s blocking it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Which means Anita, Sam, or Dwight couldn’t have seen it, either. Whatever they saw?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It didn’t happen in this room.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, if they didn’t witness the actual murder, then what did they see?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something that happened at another Best Traveler hotel. In another room 147.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We checked other branches in the area. Now, three weeks ago the Best Traveler in Long Island City rented an entire floor, including room 147, to EHI.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Their room 147 is identical to the one we found our victim in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except that fridge opens exactly like our witnesses described it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What was EHI doing there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They told the hotel it was some kind of member event.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But they brought their own security and they kept hotel staff off the floor for hours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something happened that day. Something connected to Justin’s murder that EHI wants everyone to forget.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I got something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, so I was going through surveillance footage at the Best Traveler in Long Island City. I wanted to see if any of our three confessors did attend that EHI event.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No sign of them, but I did see this.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: That’s our victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look who he’s with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Bauer lied to us. He did know Justin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We got enough for a warrant now?

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Please, you can’t take those files!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? That’s not what my warrant says. Now where’s Dr. Bauer?

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: I told you, he’s in Stockholm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where in Stockholm? What hotel?

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: I don’t know. He didn’t leave a contact number.

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: Detective, I traced the signal from Bauer’s video conference with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So where in Stockholm is he?

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: That’s the thing. The signal was routed through Stockholm, but it looks like it originated from a local IP address.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Local, as in Manhattan?

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: As in inside this building.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: You can’t go back there. This area’s restricted!

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: That one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So this is Stockholm?

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: All right, yes. I knew him. But I know nothing about his death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yet you were shredding files. Files on Anita, Sam, Dwight, Madsen … all people connected with this case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened that day? Why were you there with Justin?

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: All we did was make a film.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A film?

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: I didn’t kill Justin. I hired him as an actor.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: It was part of our image therapy pilot program.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: Been waiting for you. Come on in. 9he backs toward the fridge) Let me get you a water.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: The viewer was supposed to project their problems on a person, in this case Justin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why Anita blamed him for her drinking, and why he was the focus of Sam’s anger issues.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I knew it. You were implanting memories.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: No, no! It was supposed to help them take control of their problems by literally shooting them dead. We made two versions, one for women and another for men. For the therapy to work we had to put subjects in a chemically induced, suggestive state while showing them this footage. But it was just too real. They began to internalize the experience, then they started to believe they actually killed Justin. We halted the program immediately.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But the damage was already done.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: They threatened to sue. They said we were using them as guinea pigs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which you were.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: We tried to help them. We brought them back for one final session to correct the problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And by correcting you mean dosing them with propranolol so that they would forget they ever visited EHI.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: We were just trying to help people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that why you sent Madsen after Justin? To help him?

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: Madsen only talked with Justin, to remind him of the confidentiality agreement that prevented him from talking about the program. We knew nothing about his murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yet his death was staged to mirror that video exactly.

utterance.speaker: BAUER
utterance.content: Why would we do that when we were just trying to make this go away? No, no, no, no, no. Someone’s targeting us. Someone who knew about that tape and knew that they could use it against us. One of the other test subjects, someone on the crew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to need a list of all of the people that knew about that video.

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: Be sure not to step any further downstage or the backdrop will smack you in the head when it flies in.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. Do you have news about Justin’s case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We do. We now believe that Justin was killed because of a video he acted in.

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: A video?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was made for an organization called EHI and it just so happens it was edited by Conpost Production.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Conpost? Pam, isn’t that where your day job is?

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: Yeah, but I don’t know about any video.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We think you do. And when you saw the video you saw an opportunity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pam, we checked your credit card. We know that you just bought a flip phone.

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So just before Justin died, he was texting someone on a flip phone. Presumably his killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When we looked into the phone records there were texts, supposedly from EHI to Justin, offering him $5000 dollars to reprise his role in that video.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m betting that you gave Justin that phone. Probably told him someone from EHI dropped by, wanted him to have it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But it was SHI that sent those texts. It was you. You lured him to that hotel and then you killed him.

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: Wait, this is crazy. Justin was my friend. Why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We checked your background, Pam. One of the man that was killed in that EHI sweat lodge initiation was Alan Clark. Your brother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: EHI was to blame, but no one was held accountable. His death was ruled accidental. When you watched that video you realized you had the perfect chance to take them down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you knew you needed Justin so you found a way to get close to him.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Oh my God, that’s why you joined our theater company.

utterance.speaker: LAURA
utterance.content: Pam, what did you do?

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: You don’t understand. For Alan, for the others. Those monsters had to be stopped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By killing an innocent man?

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: Justin was not innocent. He was one of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was just an actor, hired for the day.

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: Then why did he stonewall me when I tried to talk to him about it? They are all accountable. Somebody had to stop them, somebody had to show the world what they really are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pam, turn around. You are under arrest.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: All of this was about revenge?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And unfortunately, you just caught in the middle.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: What about Dr. Bauer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: EHI has been shut down, effective immediately and the FBI is launching a full scale investigation.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: And the guy in the van, the one who drugged us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Border control caught him trying to cross into Canada. He’s being extradited back here now.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: What I don’t understand is, what made us come in when we did, all in the same day?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dr. Holloway figures it was some kind of trigger. Maybe you read an article about the murder, or you saw something on TV.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but whatever it was, it’s over now. You’re all free to go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dwight, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: Ah, it’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: No, what?

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: I just never got to confess.

utterance.speaker: ANITA
utterance.content: Well, if it makes you feel any better, I’ll hear it.

utterance.speaker: SAM
utterance.content: Yeah, me too. C’mon. I’ll buy us all a slice.

utterance.speaker: DWIGHT
utterance.content: Okay, so I walked to room 147 …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If I have to hear that confession one more time I’m going to shoot somebody.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here’s a little something to help you forget.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s okay, Castle. You know I like the weird ones. It’s interesting how malleable the human mind is. I mean, all those people wanted was a little help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But instead they became guinea pigs all because they turned to the wrong person for answers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, sometimes it’s hard to know who the right person is. After all, it took you three tries.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: True. But I figured it out. And you didn’t even have to drug me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know what I do to you when you’re sleeping?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Well whatever it is, wake me up for it next time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad … can I come home?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come here.
